messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] digest vs email
messages.msgSnippet: ... That would be even more efficient if you filtered your mail into a separate mailbox for each list. Both Eudora and Outlook Express will do that, probably
messages.messageBody:
>I sort by subject, scroll down to the bottom, delete the spam, check if there
>is any other kind of mail from less busy lists, read those, close my mailbox,
>reopen, sort by subject to check for more spam, then sort by oldest first and
>read straight through.

That would be even more efficient if you filtered your mail into a separate
mailbox for each list. Both Eudora and Outlook Express will do that,
probably others as well.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] digest vs email
messages.msgSnippet: I sort by subject, scroll down to the bottom, delete the spam, check if there is any other kind of mail from less busy lists, read those, close my mailbox,
messages.messageBody:
I sort by subject, scroll down to the bottom, delete the spam, check if there
is any other kind of mail from less busy lists, read those, close my mailbox,
reopen, sort by subject to check for more spam, then sort by oldest first and
read straight through.

But now I'm going to no mail for at least a few days so I can take care of
housebuying business!

Tuck

messages.subject: digest vs email
messages.msgSnippet: I like the digest version myself, I can just scroll through and read.  The only downside, response time from me can be slow.  Still, digest is worth the read
messages.messageBody:
I like the digest version myself, I can just scroll through and read. The
only downside, response time from me can be slow. Still, digest is worth the
read vs. filling my email box.

spc in mo
